result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph B. Ellefsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant will not request early termination of probation.

miscConds.notes:
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Maintain automobile insurance. 
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent. 
No alcohol. 
No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph B. Ellefsen

records.addlTxt:
Court in session at 311 pm. Appearances made. ADA Berg appears for the Sate of Wisconsin. Atty Mackenzie Renner appears with in custody defendant.  Matter is set for trial next week. Parties have come to an agreement. State is incompliance with chapter 950. Parties are in agreement. Defense acknowledges prior offenses. Court conducts plea colloquy. Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29, ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored, prohibition of child offender working with children pursuant to Sec. 948.13 and possession of body armor prohibited pursuant to Sec. 941.291. 
Guilty plea entered on count #1 on 22CT1, 22CF2 and 21CF437. Remaining counts and cases dismissed and read in.
Plea made freely and voluntarily. Court adjudges defendant guilty. Factual basis found. Defendant does not make statement to court. 
323 pm Court in recess
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

BOND TO COVER 22GF385, 20CF590, 21CF437, 22CF2, & 22CT1

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): SCH. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-1771

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph B. Ellefsen in court, in custody. Minutes filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

This case tracking Deft's pending files set for trial
Attorney Mackenzie Renner present in court. ADA Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deft not present, Atty Renner states he's running late. 
10:25am Case re-called, Deft still not present, Atty Renner states he's 5 min away.
10:32am Deft now present.
State has filed motion to join, Atty Renner has not had a chance to go over with Deft. Record by ADA Berg as to joinder motion. 
ADA Berg makes record that global offer was sent 3/11 by email. Atty Renner states she never received it. Atty Renner to review global offer with Deft. 
Body Cam received & notice sent to Atty Renner in July 2021, Atty Renner has not yet checked out the file since discovery came in.
State has to serve victim & 1 other witness.
Voir Dire- 2 alternates, 5 strikes each
Jurors may take notes & the may also ask questions.
State to e-file jury instructions the Friday before trial
Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared.  J J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

03:36 PM (64-06) Defendant Joseph B. Ellefsen in court with attorney Mackenzie Renner.  Samuel Thomas Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.
Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Renner acknowledged receipt of the Information and waived its reading, plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of her client. Speedy Trail reserved.

Initial appearance, reading waived, charges/penalties explained.  Preliminary hearing rights given & hearing requested with time period waived.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph B Ellefsen appeared in Court, in custody by video with Attorney Tony Kim. Vivian TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for SPD. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 21GF1334, 21CF437 & 20CF590
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH S.C.H.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Joseph B Ellefsen appeared in Court, in custody by video with Attorney Tony Kim. Vivian TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for SPD. Minutes filed.
